etymology.description: 外(outside) + 卖/賣(sell) = selling to the outside (off‑premises consumption).
etymology.interpretation: Refers to food sold for consumption away from the restaurant, often including delivery. In Taiwan, 外帶 is more common for takeout while 外賣 can refer to delivery services.
etymology.simplification: 卖 is the simplified form of 賣, reducing strokes by dropping the 貝 component and drawing on an earlier variant; 外 remains unchanged.

parts.english: sell; betray; show off; exert oneself

examples.chinese: 我们点了外卖(我們點了外賣)，因为下雨了(因為下雨了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen diǎn le wàimài, yīnwèi xiàyǔ le.
examples.english: We ordered takeout because it was raining.

examples.chinese: 这家店不提供堂食(這家店不提供堂食)，只做外卖(只做外賣)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn bù tígōng tángshí, zhǐ zuò wàimài.
examples.english: This shop doesn’t offer dine-in, only takeout.

examples.chinese: 晚上加班时(晚上加班時)，我常叫外卖(我常叫外賣)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎnshang jiābān shí, wǒ cháng jiào wàimài.
examples.english: When working late, I often order takeout.
